item.title: Coronavirus: PM 'not expecting' flood of people back to work
item.description: Boris Johnson says people should only return to the workplace if it is secure against coronavirus.

item.title: Class size of 15 pupils when primary schools return in England
item.description: Primary year groups could all have a month at school before summer, in latest Covid-19 plans.

item.title: Earlier Scotland lockdown 'could have stopped 2,000 deaths'
item.description: Scientists suggest that earlier action could have reduced the the Covid-19 death rate in Scotland by about 80%.

item.title: Coronavirus: The lost six weeks when US failed to contain outbreak
item.description: Having watched Asian and European countries struggle, the US was slow to test and lock down.

item.title: Coronavirus: Plan to ease NI lockdown 'over five stages'
item.description: Stormont ministers say they hope to bring a five-phase plan for recovery to the assembly on Tuesday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Stonehenge summer solstice gathering cancelled
item.description: The ban on mass gatherings has ruled out the event that normally attracts 10,000 visitors.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Do not drive from England to Wales to exercise'
item.description: People are warned not to travel to Wales from England for leisure activities or to second homes.

item.title: Climate change: Study pours cold water on oil company net zero claims
item.description: Doubt is cast on claims fossil fuel companies are curbing their CO2 in line with net zero targets.

item.title: Harry Dunn crash: Suspect Anne Sacoolas 'wanted internationally'
item.description: An Interpol notice has been issued in relation to suspect Anne Sacoolas.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to run a factory during a pandemic
item.description: Control Techniques is still running at full production, despite the coronavirus. Here's how.

item.title: White House staff ordered to wear masks
item.description: President Trump takes questions on testing after White House staff test positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Dorset police officer charged with murdering woman
item.description: Claire Parry, 41, died from a brain injury caused by "compression of the neck", police say.

item.title: UK drug trial for over-50s recruiting
item.description: Researchers are looking for more UK volunteers showing signs of coronavirus to test existing drugs.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Flexible' lockdown and 'no clear direction'
item.description: There is a mixed response in the papers to the prime minister's plans for easing the lockdown.

item.title: Michael Morpurgo's submission in The Book of Hopes aims to 'lift'
item.description: Michael Morpurgo is just one of more than 100 authors and illustrators who have contributed to The Book of Hopes.

item.title: Coronavirus: Four nurses on four continents tell their story
item.description: On International Nurses Day the BBC spoke to four nurses on four continents about fighting the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hairdressers among businesses to reopen in France
item.description: France has begun to ease its lockdown, and thousands of businesses have started to reopen.

item.title: International Nurses Day: The gran, mum and daughter on the front line
item.description: Meet three generations of a North East family working on the front line to fight coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: How Sweden is keeping its pubs and bars open
item.description: Sweden never went into full lockdown following the Coronavirus outbreak, so how do bars stay open?

item.title: Coronavirus: Bus driver 'happy to be home' after intensive care
item.description: We catch up with 70-year-old Ertan Nazim a month after our first visit to University College Hospital.

item.title: Drone shows Ipswich town centre empty on Saturday afternoon
item.description: The pictures show normally bustling streets deserted as the coronavirus lockdown continues.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Personal and outdoor space divide
item.description: As lockdown changes in England, there are concerns and frustration about social distancing rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dutch care home reunites families in a glass pod
item.description: With visits banned, one Dutch care home has found an innovative way to bring people together.

item.title: Coronavirus: Robot dog enforces social distancing in Singapore park
item.description: The four-legged robot carries a camera and speaker to play social distancing messages in Singapore.

item.title: Coronavirus: Crowd concerns as Australia’s restrictions ease
item.description: Crowds flock to shopping centres as Australia comes out of lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: 'They say I have blood on my hands'
item.description: Abusive messages were sent to an Asian doctor because of a myth that non-white patients are left to die.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I run lockdown marathons in the dead of night'
item.description: Runners tell of the dramatic ways their training has changed during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Lockdown: ‘Noisy neighbours are ruining my life’
item.description: Several UK councils report a rise in noise complaints since the start of the lockdown.

item.title: Joshna Maharaj - The chef who lost her sense of smell
item.description: Chef Joshna Maharaj couldn't smell for years. Now she's working to regain some of what she lost.

item.title: Coronavirus: Seacole hospital 'a tribute' to BAME NHS staff
item.description: A new community hospital recognises Jamaican-born nurse Mary Seacole - and BAME staff who have died.

item.title: The robot assistant that can guess what you want
item.description: In a five-year project a group of robotics experts have developed a robot that can assist in maintenance tasks.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I could be forced to lose a job I love'
item.description: Short notice from the government about returning to work has caused problems for some.

item.title: The tech industry's winners and losers in lockdown
item.description: Unprecedented times are bad news for many - but not all. Some major technology companies are thriving.

item.title: Coronavirus: What should my employer do to keep me safe?
item.description: The government has published new guidance on how workplaces should be made safe amid the pandemic.

item.title: The high-flying circus firm for pop and rock stars
item.description: How friends Billy Alwen and Julian Bracey built circus performance firm Cirque Bijou.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown rules now differ between Scotland and England
item.description: The guidance on what we can and cannot do is now different north and south of the border.

item.title: Eurovision: How coronavirus changed the 2020 song contest
item.description: The inside story on this year's cancellation from the artists who were due to sing in Rotterdam.

item.title: Coronavirus: Migrants struggle to send money home
item.description: The Covid-19 pandemic is limiting the ability of people to send and receive money around the world.

item.title: My Money: 'I've gone from being a photographer to a farmer'
item.description: As coronavirus hit, photographer Anna Jackson returned to help her family on their Lincolnshire farm.

item.title: Coronavirus anxiety: How to cope with life after lockdown
item.description: Mental health experts see a new phenomenon - anxiety about going back to a routine after lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italy’s other emergency - survivors’ mental health
item.description: Psychologists have seen people with coronavirus symptoms more associated with disasters or war.

item.title: Sebastian Vettel to leave Ferrari at end of Formula 1 season
item.description: Sebastian Vettel is to leave Ferrari at the end of the year after contract talks between the two break down with no agreement.

item.title: Premier League teams face £340m repayment to TV companies
item.description: Premier League clubs are told they could have to repay at least £340m to broadcasters - even if the season resumes behind closed doors.

item.title: No elite sport in England before 1 June, government announces
item.description: No professional sport, even behind closed doors, will be staged in England until 1 June at the earliest, the UK government announces.

item.title: Skateboarder Gui Khury, aged 11, breaks long-standing record with 1080-degree turn
item.description: Brazilian 11-year-old, Gui Kury, becomes the first skateboarder to complete a 1080-degree turn on a vertical ramp.

item.title: Atalanta midfielder Rinaldi dies aged 19 after suffering aneurysm
item.description: Atalanta midfielder Andrea Rinaldi dies aged 19 after suffering a brain aneurysm while training at home during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Tuesday's gossip: Ozil staying at Arsenal
item.description: Mesut Ozil not leaving Arsenal this summer, RB Leipzig want Everton target Todibo, Gomes contract talks with Man Utd stall, plus more.

item.title: How to make your own face mask
item.description: Our guide to different types of face coverings and step-by-step instructions on how to make them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I now visit a national park? And other questions
item.description: Can I now visit a national park, new quarantine rules, and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: How do I travel to work now?
item.description: Some people are being encouraged to go back to work, but how will they get there?

item.title: Coronavirus: Do I have to go back to work after lockdown?
item.description: With lockdown restrictions eased, people may start going back to work. But what are your rights?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Boris Johnson has announced changes to guidelines in England on exercise and social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask?
item.description: For the first time, people in England are being advised to wear face coverings in some situations.

item.title: Lockdown update: What are the new rules set out by Boris Johnson?
item.description: With the government easing some restrictions, how will social and work life be different?

item.title: Coronavirus: When will schools reopen?
item.description: Schools have been closed to most pupils since the end of March - when and how will they open?

item.title: Coronavirus R0: What is the R number and why does it matter?
item.description: Experts keep discussing the value of R, but what is it and why does it matter?

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the UK's test, track and trace strategy?
item.description: A guide to the three key parts of the government's coronavirus strategy after lockdowns are eased.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown is being lifted across Europe
item.description: As the UK alters its restrictions, how do other European countries plan to re-open after lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: Labour's Starmer says PM statement 'raises as many questions as answers'
item.description: People are being told to go back to work without clear safety guidance, Labour leader Keir Starmer says.
